concise_definition: interj. 哦, 哎呀, 哇

definitions.explanation_en: An exclamation used to express a wide range of emotions such as surprise, realization, pain, delight, or disappointment, often depending on tone and context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种感叹词，用于表达多种情绪，如惊讶、顿悟、痛苦、喜悦或失望，具体含义取决于语调和语境。
definitions.example_en: Oh! I didn't see you there!

definitions.explanation_en: Used to draw attention, introduce a statement, or soften the impact of what follows, often in conversational speech.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于引起注意、引出话语，或缓和后续内容的语气，常见于口语中。

definitions.explanation_en: Expresses sudden understanding or recollection, similar to 'Ah!' or 'I see!'
definitions.explanation_cn: 表示突然明白或想起某事，类似于‘啊！’或‘我明白了！’
definitions.example_en: Oh! That's why the door was locked!

comparison.analysis: “Ah” 通常表达更温和的顿悟、满足或轻微的疼痛，语调较舒缓；而 “oh” 更常用于强烈的情绪反应，如震惊或突然的醒悟，语气更外放。两者可互换，但 “oh” 情感强度更高。
“Wow” 专用于表达惊叹或赞赏，多为正面情绪；而 “oh” 的情感范围更广，可正可负，如惊讶、失望、痛苦等，适用性更广泛。
“Uh” 是犹豫或思考时的填充词，属于非语言性停顿；而 “oh” 是有明确语义的感叹词，用于传达情绪或认知变化，二者功能完全不同。
